alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 09 at 1:47PM MST until August 09 at 4:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Peeples Valley and Kirkland in central Yavapai County... * Until 445 PM MST. * At 144 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain north of Peeples Valley, south and southwest of Kirkland. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Kirkland and Peeples Valley. This includes the following highways... State Route 89 between mile markers 280 and 290. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Copper Basin Wash, Model Creek, Miller Creek, Woolsey Wash, Poplar Wash, North Fork Date Creek, Martinez Creek, Waterman Creek, Alkali Wash, Finch Wash, Skull Valley Wash and Kirkland Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
